clinical_study.brief_title: DAAs Treatment for Chronic HCV/HBV Co-infection Patients(DASCO)
clinical_study.official_title: Direct Antiviral Agents for the Treatment of Chronic HCV/HBV Co-infection Patients

collaborator.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective study to determine the incidence, morbidity, mortality and predisposing factors for the reactivation of hepatitis B virus replication during direct anti-HCV treatment of HCV/HBV co-infection patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients who receive direct-acting anti-HCV treatment will be prospectively studied during 2-year period. All patients have HCV/HBV co-infection.
The inclusion/exclusion criteria and the follow up plan will be listed in following part.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants who experience virological breakthrough
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the commencement of DAAs treatment to 12 weeks post DAAs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Virological breakthrough is defined as 1 logIU/ml increase during and/or post DAAs treatment for the baseline or nadir.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants who experience virological rebound
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the commencement of DAAs treatment to 12 weeks post DAAs treatment
primary_outcome.description: Virological rebound is defined as 2 logIU/ml increase during and/or post DAAs treatment for the baseline or nadir.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participant who experience biochemical rebound
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the commencement of DAAs treatment to 12 weeks post DAAs treatment

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of participant who experience liver failure
other_outcome.time_frame: From the commencement of DAAs treatment to 12 weeks post DAAs treatment

arm_group.description: HCV/HBV co-infection patients in this arm will receive nucleos(t)ides analog (Entecavir or Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate) for the treatment of hepatitis B infection before or at the commencement of direct anti-HCV treatment using DAAs (Ledipasvir/Sofosbuvir; or Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir, or Ombitasvir, Paritaprevir, Ritonavir, Dasabuvir; or Sofosbuvir+Ribavirin).

HCV/HBV co-infection patients in this arm will receive nucleos(t)ides analog (Entecavir or Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate) for the treatment of hepatitis B infection when HBV viral breakthrough occurred during anti-HCV treatment using DAAs (Ledipasvir/Sofosbuvir; or Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir, or Ombitasvir, Paritaprevir, Ritonavir, Dasabuvir; or Sofosbuvir+Ribavirin).

intervention.description: Oral direct anti-HCV agent. Ledipasvir/Sofosbuvir(LDV/SOF) 400mg/90mg fixed-dose combination(FDC) tablet, administered orally once daily.
TWO oral direct anti-HCV agent: Sofosbuvir(SOF), 400mg tablet administered orally once daily. Daclatavir(DCV), 60mg tablet administered orally once daily.

VIEKIRA PAK includes ombitasvir, a hepatitis C virus NS5A inhibitor, paritaprevir, a hepatitis C virus NS3/4A protease inhibitor, ritonavir, a CYP3A inhibitor and dasabuvir, a hepatitis C virus non-nucleoside NS5B palm polymerase inhibitor.
Nucleoside-inhibitor-treatment-naïve with compensated liver disease (greater than or equal to 16 years old): 0.5 mg once daily.
VIREAD is indicated for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B in adults and pediatric patients 12 years of age and older.
